subject: p16662264
History: -year-old woman with history of end-stage renal disease status post renal transplant, on immunosuppression. Acutely desating with ambulation. Evaluate for pneumonia or edema.
Findings: Previously seen basal consolidations and diffuse abnormalities in the upper lungs have improved when compared to the study. However, moderate-sized bilateral pleural effusions have worsened from although appear stable from the chest CT of. There are no new areas of consolidation or evidence of pulmonary edema. Cardiomediastinal contours are unchanged.
